rdf:Alt.rdf:li: {\rtf1 }
{\rtf1 hi and welcome to technical editing Tec}
{\rtf1 m51 95 today we're going to talk about}
{\rtf1 what is technical editing and so when we}
{\rtf1 think about technical editing this is}
{\rtf1 the picture that most people come up}
{\rtf1 with in their minds right so sitting at}
{\rtf1 your desk with the red pen correcting}
{\rtf1 grammar or correcting punctuation but I}
{\rtf1 want to argue that technical editing is}
{\rtf1 much broader than that so the purpose of}
{\rtf1 this presentation is really to give you}
{\rtf1 an understanding of what technical}
{\rtf1 editing is and then also what we'll do}
{\rtf1 in this course so give you a little bit}
{\rtf1 of a preview of the course so when we}
{\rtf1 think about editing we think about}
{\rtf1 levels of editing and really for our}
{\rtf1 purposes we're going to focus on three}
{\rtf1 levels of editing proofreading copy}
{\rtf1 editing and comprehensive editing we're}
{\rtf1 not going to talk about too much about}
{\rtf1 proofreading proofreading really}
{\rtf1 actually comes from this idea of daily}
{\rtf1 proofs these are sort of the final}
{\rtf1 versions of a document that a a}
{\rtf1 proofreader would look at and make sure}
{\rtf1 it was correct right so for example if}
{\rtf1 the style guide called for one space}
{\rtf1 after a period instead of two spaces the}
{\rtf1 proofreader would make sure that all of}
{\rtf1 the spacing was correct so proofreading}
{\rtf1 typically happens at the very end of the}
{\rtf1 editorial process so the purposes of}
{\rtf1 this course we're not going to cover}
{\rtf1 proofreading we will however cover copy}
{\rtf1 editing and comprehensive editing copy}
{\rtf1 editing really is sentence level editing}
{\rtf1 and really looking at things that have}
{\rtf1 specific rules so these are graham}
{\rtf1 editing for grammar editing for}
{\rtf1 punctuation and then obviously things}
{\rtf1 like editing for spelling}
{\rtf1 capitalizations and abbreviations right}
{\rtf1 so things that are there are rules for}
{\rtf1 that there is right and wrong for is}
{\rtf1 typically falls under the umbrella of}
{\rtf1 copy editing and then finally is}
{\rtf1 comprehensive editing which is as the}
{\rtf1 name suggests encompasses all editorial}
{\rtf1 activities but this is starting to edit}
{\rtf1 beyond just the sentence level right}
{\rtf1 looking at a document}
{\rtf1 the document as a whole so those are the}
{\rtf1 three levels of edit I think a better}
{\rtf1 way for me to think about editing is on}
{\rtf1 this continuum so on the left-hand side}
{\rtf1 you have really sort of objective}
{\rtf1 editorial activities things that require}
{\rtf1 very little editorial judgment because}
{\rtf1 there's rules so this this is like copy}
{\rtf1 editing for grammar and punctuation}
{\rtf1 right so a sentence is a sentence}
{\rtf1 there's a rule for what makes a sentence}
{\rtf1 a comma is a comma there's a rule for}
{\rtf1 when to use a particular comma in a}
{\rtf1 particular context and on the right-hand}
{\rtf1 side we've got comprehensive editing}
{\rtf1 which is editorial activities that are}
{\rtf1 that that that require less rules that}
{\rtf1 are more subjective and these require}
{\rtf1 the most amount of editorial judgment so}
{\rtf1 an example of this might be you've got a}
{\rtf1 document with a with a graphic in it}
{\rtf1 that that is alluding to some cultural}
{\rtf1 reference from the 80s well if you know}
{\rtf1 that your audience is 21 to 25 year olds}
{\rtf1 or people born much later than the 80s}
{\rtf1 as an editor you can think about your}
{\rtf1 audience in your context and you might}
{\rtf1 say let's change out this graphic for a}
{\rtf1 more relevant graphic a graphic that}
{\rtf1 speaks to this particular audience right}
{\rtf1 and so that requires much more judgement}
{\rtf1 because there's no rule for that there's}
{\rtf1 no rule that you must have this type of}
{\rtf1 graphic instead of this type of graphic}
{\rtf1 and then along the continuum our other}
{\rtf1 editorial activities and this is not a}
{\rtf1 comprehensive list of activities these}
{\rtf1 are just some examples that I've pulled}
{\rtf1 out so along the continuum of got}
{\rtf1 editing for style right so deciding}
{\rtf1 whether or not to use active or passive}
{\rtf1 voice right there's no rule they're both}
{\rtf1 grammatically correct but there's}
{\rtf1 particular contexts where active voice}
{\rtf1 is better than passive and passive is}
{\rtf1 better than active or editing for tone}
{\rtf1 where you've got a professional tone or}
{\rtf1 a personal tone or a light-hearted tone}
{\rtf1 right so thinking through who is my}
{\rtf1 audience and what kind of tone would}
{\rtf1 they prefer or what kind of content am i}
{\rtf1 presenting to them and so thinking}
{\rtf1 through style}
{\rtf1 that's sort of walking along the}
{\rtf1 continuum and then we can continue to go}
{\rtf1 along the continuum and we can start to}
{\rtf1 edit for things like organization right}
{\rtf1 like on a macro level you've got}
{\rtf1 organization and you need to decide okay}
{\rtf1 do all of the parts of this document}
{\rtf1 connect to one another right so that's}
{\rtf1 sort of macro level organization right}
{\rtf1 do we need to rearrange some of this}
{\rtf1 content do we need to rethink the}
{\rtf1 introduction or connect the introduction}
{\rtf1 to the next section of the document and}
{\rtf1 we've also got micro level organization}
{\rtf1 right does this sentence connect to the}
{\rtf1 sentence before and the sentence after}
{\rtf1 so thinking about the cohesion of a}
{\rtf1 document but these are just a I think a}
{\rtf1 helpful way of thinking about editing is}
{\rtf1 on this continuum of some of this}
{\rtf1 requires a lot of judgment right}
{\rtf1 experience practice thinking through our}
{\rtf1 audience and some of it you've got a}
{\rtf1 rulebook for right and so editing in}
{\rtf1 this course and in general encompasses}
{\rtf1 all of these activities so just sort of}
{\rtf1 a recap some lesser-known activities of}
{\rtf1 technical editors these are some things}
{\rtf1 that we'll cover in this course}
{\rtf1 rhetorical and audience analysis right}
{\rtf1 thinking through the situation in the}
{\rtf1 context who our audience is how they'll}
{\rtf1 use the document editing for style tone}
{\rtf1 and organization right so really just}
{\rtf1 thinking outside of the box of I just}
{\rtf1 need to make this right I need to use}
{\rtf1 semicolons correctly or you need to use}
{\rtf1 commas correctly but thinking through}
{\rtf1 what's the best way to present this}
{\rtf1 content and then thinking through ideas}
{\rtf1 and activities of content creation and}
{\rtf1 management Eurasian and management right}
{\rtf1 so if you've got you're working with a}
{\rtf1 group of writers and they've written ten}
{\rtf1 articles you can curate some of these}
{\rtf1 articles right so I'm going to pick five}
{\rtf1 out of five articles out of these ten -}
{\rtf1 to cover a particular topic and that's}
{\rtf1 really sort of where technical}
{\rtf1 communication and technical editing is}
{\rtf1 going is sort of these smaller chunks of}
{\rtf1 content and curating the smaller chuck}
{\rtf1 smaller chunks of content into a}
{\rtf1 cohesive document}
{\rtf1 so how is this class structure well we}
{\rtf1 will do some of the nuts and bolts copy}
{\rtf1 editing so grammar and punctuation}
{\rtf1 that's in weeks one and two we're just}
{\rtf1 going to start with that and then we'll}
{\rtf1 move into comprehensive editing will}
{\rtf1 move into editing for style and tone}
{\rtf1 will move into editing for organization}
{\rtf1 and then we'll really think through}
{\rtf1 audience analysis rhetorical analysis}
{\rtf1 and editing a document holistically and}
{\rtf1 then we'll close this semester with}
{\rtf1 looking at some management activities of}
{\rtf1 editors some project management}
{\rtf1 activities how to deal with clients how}
{\rtf1 to work with clients how to create a a}
{\rtf1 schedule for for completing an editing}
{\rtf1 project so that's sort of the breakdown}
{\rtf1 at a very high level the last thing I}
{\rtf1 want to talk about is how does this}
{\rtf1 course connect to the teaching of}
{\rtf1 technical communication so many of you}
{\rtf1 are students in our certificate program}
{\rtf1 for the teaching of technical}
{\rtf1 communication I want to specifically}
{\rtf1 address that so first this course}
{\rtf1 focuses on revision and revision and}
{\rtf1 editing obviously but everything we}
{\rtf1 cover in this course you're gonna have}
{\rtf1 to teach students and you're gonna have}
{\rtf1 to teach students how to produce right}
{\rtf1 grammatically correct content you have}
{\rtf1 to teach them how to produce cohesive}
{\rtf1 content you have to teach them how to do}
{\rtf1 audience and rhetorical analysis so all}
{\rtf1 of these principles and bits of}
{\rtf1 knowledge that you'll that we'll cover}
{\rtf1 in this course}
{\rtf1 I think translate directly to an intro}
{\rtf1 to technical communication course but}
{\rtf1 beyond that I'm going to also sprinkle}
{\rtf1 in pedagogical strategies that you can}
{\rtf1 take with you to your classroom as you}
{\rtf1 teach technical communication so there}
{\rtf1 are specific tricks or tips or}
{\rtf1 strategies to teaching grammar and}
{\rtf1 punctuation that you can then use in}
{\rtf1 your classrooms and so those are the two}
{\rtf1 main ways that we'll connect this course}
{\rtf1 to teaching of technical communication}
{\rtf1 so I'm excited for this course and we}
{\rtf1 will continue on grammar and punctuation}
{\rtf1 throughout the next two weeks}

rdf:Description.xmpDM:name: Lesser known activities of technical editors
